meanings.definition: To douse with liquor and ignite.
meanings.sent1: The chef will flambe the dessert at the table.
meanings.sent2: She likes to flambe the steak for a special touch.
meanings.sent3: The party was a hit when they flambeed the cake.
meanings.sent4: His passion flambeed like a blazing fire.
meanings.sent5: The flames danced as he flambeed the pan.

meanings.sent1: The flambe was the highlight of the dinner party.

meanings.sent3: The chef's specialty was the flambe, always a crowd-pleaser.
meanings.sent4: The flambe on the menu caught my eye immediately.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the flambe filled the room with warmth.
